title: What are some of the best works of novel-length Harry Potter fanfiction? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve browsed through many a FanFiction, but I generally only read a couple chapters before abandoning it. These are the ones I couldn’t stop: *Looking back after I’ve finished, I notice that none of these are really tailored for the younger crowd. Um… warning, adult content, I guess? **Dumbledore’s Army and the Year of Darkness, Slaugh, A Peccatis: There are some weird issues surrounding this little (unfinished) trilogy that I don’t fully understand, but there was a time when I enjoyed them very much. It follows Neville leading Dumbledore’s Army, then graduating and becoming an Auror. DAYD is great in that if you like the first chapter you’ll like the whole first one. There are scenes that might be overly graphic, there are scenes that might be overly goofy, there are scenes that might be too on the nose, and people say that it’s sexist or something, I didn’t notice anything too ridiculous but there’s that. I still like it. Slaugh… I mean, it’s crazy. Ridiculously dark, full of graphic themes, so on, but again, if you can make to the end, you probably liked it. A Peccatis? Not done, but what’s there is, in my opinion, a very engaging mystery story that portrays how Aurors work better than anything else I’ve read. The Life and Times: Definitely the best Marauder-Era story I’ve ever read, and one of the better love stories, and that’s not just counting FanFiction. The mains (James/Lily) are both done fantastically, but I should mention how amazing the original characters are as well. There are entire chapters devoted to OCs, and it doesn’t feel like mush between the James/Lily stuff. The ending is a little clunky, but it works. On the Way to Greatness: Hands down best FanFiction I’ve ever read. I’m biased because it’s about Harry being sorted into Slytherin and I’m in Slytherin, but I digress. I’ve made it through the whole thing two or three times. Instead of rewriting the entirety of every year, the author does one chapter for first year, two for second, three for third, etc. It really gets things moving to the more interesting (plot-wise) second half, but the first half is chock-full of development. He shows why Harry is basically a different person by the fifth year, just in time for the war with Voldemort to start. If I tried to explain everything I like about it, this would get too long, so I’m just going to say that, out of the three, I most strongly encourage anyone to read this. Edit: **I’m not going to pretend that this answer ever received a whole lot of attention, but if anyone ever does wade through some of the older stuff on this site, I feel like I should emphasize the “weird issues” I mentioned in my brief review of the DAYDverse. I don’t know exactly what the author did, but a lot of people hate him, like really hate him now, to the point where I’m a little surprised that no one has left a comment condemning him/the work. I’ve had trouble tracking down a clear explanation of his transgressions, or I found one and forgot about it long ago; either way, I’m not letting him or the opinions people have about him stop me from enjoying what I think is a good story (again, a lot of people have issues with it, but I read it a long time ago and I’m a sucker for nostalgia). Pardon me, I’m getting long-winded; the point is, all three of the stories have been deleted from FanFiction and I don’t know of any other place you can find them. And so, the whole affair is ended rather anticlimactically (at least from my perspective). P.S. Seriously though, go read On the Way to Greatness.

It’s really hard to say, as it depends heavily on what kind of thing you are looking for. Are you looking for a romance? An action? A mystery? What characters do you want a focus on? What ships do you prefer? Do you prefer canon or AU? It’s a good thing you’ve got a ton of answers so far, as you can theoretically narrow it down to the answers that mention your preferences and sift through ones you want to read. But I went through a lot of the answers (by no means all of them), and was surprised to see that none of the ones that I favor made any of the lists (again, I didn’t go through all of the answers, so I easily could’ve missed someone who did list them). So, I will say ahead of time that I tend to prefer canon couples (I have a few favorites: Harry/Ginny and James/Lily) in fics that are strictly canonical. Genre is typically romance, but not entirely centered around the romance (as in, there’s a plot other than the two characters getting together). Ginny Weasley and the Half-Blood Prince by RRFang Complete - This is an extremely well-written fic. I think the characterizations are spot on, and the romance is great. As the title suggests, it is the Half-Blood Prince (and The Deathly Hallows) told from Ginny’s point of view. In the Words of Ginevra Molly Potter by thejealousone Complete - Similar to the one above it, but the entire series from Ginny’s point of view. Also extremely well written. Ginny is a little overly powerful occasionally throughout the fic (in my opinion), but that’s just a minor pet peeve of mine. And it doesn’t really matter, because the fic is just so good. Those are really the only two fics that have ever drawn me in, start to finish, that are centered around the same timeline as the books. Future or post-war fics haven’t ever been my cup of tea. Onto my favorite timeline, though: the Marauders! I’ll Take it Shaken, Not Stirred and The Life and Times, both by Jewels5 Complete These are both stories about how Lily and James got over their differences and eventually fell in love. Both extremely well written, with fully fleshed out and 3-dimensional OCs. The first was written before DH, the second after, so the first doesn’t involve Snape or James being a chaser or various other little things that weren’t known at the time (though I actually prefer it, mainly because I prefer the OCs in it). These both avoid a lot of Lily/James story stereotypes (like every Maruader gets paired off with Lily’s friends, or James is some stupid, love-sick boy put on the earth simply to pine after Lily, or the Marauders don’t use their establishes nicknames but rather very girly versions [Prongsie, Paddy], etc.), which is a very good thing. Against the Moon by Spotlight Delight In Progress, temp Hiatus Often attempted, rarely done well, never finished (that I’ve ever seen). The entirety of the Marauders time at Hogwarts. This is a fic centered on Lupin, starting with the train ride to Hogwarts (well, a prologue about him being bitten first) and theoretically going all the way through their years at Hogwarts. Can’t know for sure, as it’s still in progress, but that’s what I assume. Could end sooner or go on further. I actually am not through to the most recent chapters myself. I’m on chapter 71 currently, of 134 (so far). The fic is extremely well written, and is long. It doesn’t fly through any part of the story. Everything is detailed. I will add a small complaint, which is that the characterizations aren’t exactly as I’ve always pictured. Sirius is shown to be a little too sensitive and is shown to be more fiercely loyal than James, which seems a bit incongruent to what we’ve always heard. And Peter is shown to be rather stupid, which I feel is a common misconception about the character (he did become an Animagus, helped with the Marauders map, and blasted away 12 muggles with a single curse with his wand behind his back, after all), but overall it’s very, very good so far. And everything else seems spot on, so either that’s just how the author views them (it’s her fic, so the characterizations are up to her anyway) or she plans to have them grow into what we know about them along the way. Either way, whether they change into what I’ve always thought they were supposed to be like (again, that’s just me; everyone has their own view) or they stay the way they are, the fic is just incredible. It’s only a minor complaint, and it hasn’t kept me from refusing to put this thing down. It is on a temporary hiatus as the author focuses on another fic at the moment, but she has updated her profile recently to assure everyone the fic will continue, and her most recent update to the story she is currently focusing on was yesterday, so she hasn’t disappeared from the website either. Also, though it seems to be implied throughout the story, the author has confirmed this is not going to be a WolfStar fic, so if that’s what you want, this isn’t for you. And there you have it. I’ve never looked at other FanFic websites, and unfortunately, good writers with good ideas seem to be few and far between on FanFiction.net (in my opinion), so I only have 5 to offer. But these are really, really good in my opinion, and if you like Harry/Ginny and/or the Marauders in general, I think you’ll love them.
